CORE PRINCIPLES:

1. PERFORMANCE FIRST (NON-NEGOTIABLE)
   - All PDFs must generate in under 2 seconds (P95 latency)
   - Browser session reuse is mandatory for performance
   - Promise pipelining must be used for batch operations
   - No cold starts - keep Chrome instances warm

2. SECURITY & AUTHENTICATION
   - All API keys MUST be SHA-256 hashed before storage
   - Never store plaintext API keys
   - Row Level Security (RLS) must be enabled on all Supabase tables
   - Rate limiting is mandatory on all API endpoints
   - CORS must be properly configured

3. DESIGN SYSTEM STANDARDS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)
   - ONLY use OKLCH color space - never RGB, HSL, or hex colors
   - All colors must be perceptually uniform for accessibility
   - WCAG AAA contrast compliance is mandatory
   - Elevation system uses OKLCH lightness manipulation only
   - shadcn/ui components exclusively - no other UI libraries

4. TECHNOLOGY STACK CONSTRAINTS
   - Frontend: Next.js 15 with App Router (mandatory)
   - Backend: Cloudflare Workers (mandatory)
   - RPC: Cap'n Web for all PDF generation (mandatory)
   - Database: Supabase with RLS policies (mandatory)
   - Payments: DodoPayments (mandatory)
   - Styling: Tailwind CSS with OKLCH tokens (mandatory)

5. CODE QUALITY
   - TypeScript strict mode required
   - All functions must have proper error handling
   - No console.log in production code
   - Zod schemas for all API validation
   - Proper resource disposal for browser instances

6. CAP'N WEB BEST PRACTICES (CRITICAL)
   - Always extend RpcTarget for server-side classes
   - Use promise pipelining for dependent operations
   - Dispose resources properly with 'using' keyword
   - Keep WebSocket sessions alive with heartbeats
   - Never block the event loop in RPC methods

7. USER EXPERIENCE
   - Landing page must load in under 2 seconds
   - Live demo must work without signup
   - Dark mode support is mandatory
   - Mobile-responsive design required
   - Lighthouse score must be 95+ on all pages

8. TESTING & QUALITY
   - Unit tests for critical business logic
   - Integration tests for API endpoints
   - E2E tests for user flows (signup, generate PDF)
   - 80%+ code coverage target
   - No broken links or 404 errors

9. DOCUMENTATION
   - All API endpoints must be documented
   - Code examples in JavaScript, Python, PHP, Ruby
   - README with setup instructions
   - Inline comments for complex logic

10. DEPLOYMENT & OPERATIONS
    - Zero-downtime deployments
    - Error tracking with Sentry
    - Uptime monitoring with 99.9% SLA
    - Proper logging for debugging
    - Environment variables for all secrets

GOVERNANCE:
- Constitution supersedes all other practices
- Deviations require explicit documentation and approval
- All PRs must verify compliance with these principles
- Performance regressions are blocking issues
- Security issues are critical priority

REFERENCE DOCUMENTS:
The following markdown files in this directory contain detailed technical specifications and must be consulted during planning and implementation:
- SPEEDSTEIN_TECHNICAL_SPEC.md
- SPEEDSTEIN_API_REFERENCE.md
- SPEEDSTEIN_IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md
- SPEEDSTEIN_TECHSTACK.md)
